greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A336467(A122111(n)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..12166
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
formula: For noncomposite n, a(n) = 1, for composite n, a(n) = A000265(A105560(n)+1) * a(A064989(n)).
program: A122111(n) = if(1==n,n,my(f=factor(n), es=Vecrev(f[,2]),is=concat(apply(primepi,Vecrev(f[,1])),[0]),pri=0,m=1); for(i=1, #es, pri += es[i]; m *= prime(pri)^(is[i]-is[1+i])); (m));
A064989(n) = {my(f); f = factor(n); if((n>1 && f[1,1]==2), f[1,2] = 0); for (i=1, #f~, f[i,1] = precprime(f[i,1]-1)); factorback(f)};
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 25 2020
